  7447                                  
  7448                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7449                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7450                                  ;
  7451                                  ; dmax_check --- call this when we want to install a new drive.
  7452                                  ;		it checks for drvmax < 26 to see if there is
  7453                                  ;		a drive letter left.
  7454                                  ;
  7455                                  ;	drvmax < 26 : carry SET!
  7456                                  ;	drvmax >=26 : carry RESET!, error flag set for message later
  7457                                  ;			trash ax
  7458                                  
  7459                                  dmax_check:
  7460 00002042 803E[7500]1A            		cmp	byte [drvmax], 26 ; checks for drvmax < 26
  7461 00002047 720D                    		jb	short dmax_ok	; returns with carry if okay
  7462 00002049 06                      		push	es
  7463                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; SYSINIT_SEG (SYSINIT segment)
  7464 0000204A B82704                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 17/10/2022	
  7465 0000204D 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  7466                                  		; 18/10/2022
  7467 0000204F 26C606[8303]01          		mov	byte [es:TOOMANYDRIVESFLAG], 1 ; 09/12/2022 
  7468                                  		;mov	byte ptr es:3FFh, 1 ; [es:toomanydrivesflag]
  7469                                  					; set message flag
  7470                                  					; [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag]
  7471 00002055 07                      		pop	es
  7472                                  
  7473                                  		;;push	es
  7474                                  		;;mov	ax,SYSINIT_SEG
  7475                                  		;;mov	es,ax
  7476                                  		;;mov	byte [es:toomanydrivesflag],1
  7477                                  					; set message flag
  7478                                  		;;pop	es
  7479                                  		;
  7480                                  		;mov	byte [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag],1
  7481                                  dmax_ok:
  7482 00002056 C3                      		retn
  7483                                  
  7484                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7485                                  
  7486                                  ; 18/10/2022
  7487                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7488                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  7489                                  ;								 
  7490                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  7491                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  7492                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  7493                                  
  7494                                  xinstall_bds:		
  7495 00002057 56                      		push	si
  7496 00002058 53                      		push	bx
  7497 00002059 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  7498                                  xinstall_bds_1:				
  7499 0000205D 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; is this the last one?
  7500 00002060 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ; skip ahead if so
  7501                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  7502 00002062 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  7503 00002064 EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  7504                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7505                                  
  7506                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  7507                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  7508 00002066 893C                    		mov	[si], di
  7509                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link+2], ds
  7510 00002068 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  7511                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  7512 0000206B C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  7513                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  7514 0000206F 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  7515                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7516                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  7517 00002072 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  7518 00002075 8B36[F615]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  7519 00002079 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  7520 0000207B 8306[F615]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  7521 00002080 FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  7522 00002084 8306[F815]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  7523 00002089 5B                      		pop	bx
  7524 0000208A 5E                      		pop	si
  7525 0000208B C3                      		retn
  7526                                  
  7527                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7528                                  
  7529                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7530                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7531                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7532                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7533                                  
  7534                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7535                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  7536 0000208C 50                      		push	ax
  7537 0000208D 51                      		push	cx
  7538 0000208E 52                      		push	dx
  7539 0000208F 55                      		push	bp
  7540 00002090 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  7541                                  loop_clock:
  7542 00002092 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  7543 00002094 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7544 00002096 B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  7545 00002098 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7546                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  7547                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  7548                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  7549 0000209A 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  7550 0000209D 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7551 0000209F 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  7552 000020A2 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7553 000020A4 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  7554 000020A7 741B                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  7555 000020A9 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  7556 000020AA B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  7557                                  delay:
  7558 000020AD E2FE                    		loop	delay
  7559 000020AF EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  7560                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7561                                  
  7562                                  clock_present:
  7563                                  		;mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  7564                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7565                                  		; ds = cs
  7566 000020B1 C606[EC04]01            		mov	byte [havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  7567                                  		
  7568 000020B6 E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  7569                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  7570                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  7571 000020B9 56                      		push	si
  7572 000020BA E82FF3                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  7573 000020BD FA                      		cli
  7574                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  7575 000020BE 8936[E904]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  7576 000020C2 FB                      		sti
  7577 000020C3 5E                      		pop	si
  7578                                  no_readdate:
  7579 000020C4 5D                      		pop	bp
  7580 000020C5 5A                      		pop	dx
  7581 000020C6 59                      		pop	cx
  7582 000020C7 58                      		pop	ax
  7583                                  cmosck9:	; 19/12/2023
  7584 000020C8 C3                      		retn
  7585                                  
  7586                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7587                                  
  7588                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  7589                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  7590                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  7591                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  7592                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  7593                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  7594                                  ;
  7595                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  7596                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  7597                                  ;
  7598                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  7599                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  7600                                  ;
  7601                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  7602                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  7603                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initialization routine
  7604                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  7605                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  7606                                  ;
  7607                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  7608                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  7609                                  
  7610                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits
  7611                                  
  7612                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  7613                                  
  7614                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7615                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  7616                                  
  7617                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7618                                  		; ds = cs
  7619                                  		;push	ax ; not necessary ; 19/12/2023
  7620                                  		;
  7621 000020C9 803E[2D06]FC            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FCh
  7622                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  7623 000020CE 75F8                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  7624 000020D0 803E[2E06]06            		cmp	byte [secondary_model_byte], 6 ; 21/04/2024
  7625                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  7626                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  7627 000020D5 7407                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS periodic rate if 06
  7628 000020D7 803E[2E06]04            		cmp	byte [secondary_model_byte], 4
  7629                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  7630                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  7631 000020DC 73EA                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST
  7632                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0
  7633                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  7634                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE
  7635                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06
  7636                                  cmosck4:
  7637 000020DE B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  7638                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7639 000020E0 B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  7640                                  					; Set divider & rate selection
  7641 000020E2 E80B00                  		call	cmos_write
  7642 000020E5 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  7643                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7644 000020E7 E82000                  		call	cmos_read
  7645 000020EA 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  7646                                  					; clear SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  7647 000020EC 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  7648 000020EE B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  7649                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  7650                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7651                                  		;call	cmos_write
  7652                                  ;cmosck9:
  7653                                  		;pop	ax ; 19/12/2023
  7654                                  		;retn
  7655                                  
  7656                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7657                                  		;jmp	short cmos_write
  7658                                  
  7659                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7660                                  
  7661                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  7662                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7663                                  ;									       :
  7664                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  7665                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7666                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  7667                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  7668                                  ;									       :
  7669                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  7670                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  7671                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7672                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7673                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7674                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7675                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7676                                  
  7677                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)
  7678 000020F0 9C                      		pushf			;
  7679 000020F1 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  7680 000020F2 FA                      		cli
  7681 000020F3 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  7682 000020F4 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  7683 000020F6 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7684                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7685 000020F8 90                      		nop
  7686 000020F9 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  7687 000020FB E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7688 000020FD 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  7689 000020FE 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7690 00002100 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7691 00002102 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7692                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7693 00002104 90                      		nop
  7694 00002105 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7695 00002107 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  7696                                  
  7697                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7698                                  		;push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7699                                  		;call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7700                                  		;retn
  7701 00002108 EB18                    		jmp	short cmos_rw_popf
  7702                                  
  7703                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7704                                  
  7705                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  7706                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7707                                  ;									       :
  7708                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  7709                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7710                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  7711                                  ;									       :
  7712                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  7713                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled. during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  7714                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7715                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7716                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7717                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7718                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7719                                  
  7720                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)
  7721 0000210A 9C                      		pushf
  7722 0000210B FA                      		cli
  7723 0000210C 53                      		push	bx
  7724                                  		;push	ax ; *		; AL = cmos table address to be read
  7725                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7726 0000210D 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax ; * ; input
  7727 0000210F 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  7728 00002111 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7729                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7730 00002113 90                      		nop			; (undocumented delay needed)
  7731 00002114 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7732                                  		
  7733                                  		;mov	bx, ax ; output
  7734                                  		;pop	ax ; * ; input
  7735                                  
  7736                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7737                                  		; al = output, bl = input
  7738 00002116 93                      		xchg	ax, bx ; *
  7739                                  		; bl = output, al = input
  7740                                  	
  7741 00002117 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7742 00002119 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7743 0000211B E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7744                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7745 0000211D 90                      		nop
  7746 0000211E E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7747                                  		;mov	ax, bx ; * ; output
  7748                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7749 00002120 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  7750 00002121 5B                      		pop	bx
  7751                                  
  7752                                  		; 19/12/2023
  7753                                  cmos_rw_popf:
  7754 00002122 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7755 00002123 E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7756 00002126 C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  7757                                  
  7758                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7759                                  
  7760                                  cmos_popf:				
  7761 00002127 CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  7762                                  					; return far and restore flags
  7763                                  
  7764                                  ; 21/12/2022
  7765                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7766                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7767                                  %if 0
  7768                                  
  7769                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7770                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7771                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7772                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  7773                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7774                                  
  7775                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7776                                  ;
  7777                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  7778                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  7779                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  7780                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  7781                                  
  7782                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7783                                  
  7784                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  7785                                  ;
  7786                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  7787                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  7788                                  ;  es:di = load location
  7789                                  
  7790                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7791                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7792                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7793                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  7794                                  
  7795                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7796                                  getclus:
  7797                                  		; 14/12/2023
  7798                                  		; 13/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS)
  7799                                  		; ds = cs
  7800                                  
  7801                                  		push	cx
  7802                                  		push	di
  7803                                  		;mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7804                                  		mov	[doscnt], cx ; 13/12/2023
  7805                                  		mov	ax, bx
  7806                                  		dec	ax
  7807                                  		dec	ax
  7808                                  		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  7809                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  7810                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  7811                                  		;add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  7812                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7813                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7814                                  		add	ax, [bios_l]
  7815                                  		adc	dx, [bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7816                                  unpack:
  7817                                  		push	ds ; ds = cs ; 13/12/2023
  7818                                  		push	dx ; * ; 13/12/2023
  7819                                  		push	ax
  7820                                  		push	bx
  7821                                  		;mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  7822                                  		mov	si, [fatloc] ; 13/12/2023
  7823                                  		mov	ds, si
  7824                                  		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  7825                                  		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  7826                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  7827                                  		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  7828                                  		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  7829                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  7830                                  		add	si, bx		;
  7831                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  7832                                  		;push	dx ; 13/12/2023
  7833                                  		xor	dx, dx
  7834                                  		; 12/12/2023
  7835                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  7836                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7837                                  		;pop	dx ; 12/12/2023
  7838                                  
  7839                                  		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  7840                                  		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  7841                                  		; 25/06/2023
  7842                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  7843                                  
  7844                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7845                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  7846                                  		push	ax ; **	; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
  7847                                  
  7848                                  		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  7849                                  
  7850                                  		;push	dx ; 13/12/2023
  7851                                  		xor	dx, dx
  7852                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7853                                  		;pop	dx ; 13/12/2023
  7854                                  
  7855                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  7856                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7857                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  7858                                  		;mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  7859                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  7860                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7861                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7862                                  		;mov	al, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7863                                  		pop	ax  ; ** ; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
  7864                                  		mov	ah, [0] ; high 4 bits (bits 7 to 11) of 12 bits cluster num
  7865                                  even_odd:
  7866                                  		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  7867                                  		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  7868                                  		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  7869                                  		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  7870                                  		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  7871                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  7872                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7873                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7874                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7875                                  havclus:
  7876                                  		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  7877                                  		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  7878                                  		jmp	short unpackx
  7879                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7880                                  
  7881                                  unpack16:
  7882                                  		;push	dx	; 13/12/2023	
  7883                                  		xor	dx, dx ; 0
  7884                                  		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  7885                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  7886                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7887                                  		rcl	dx, 1
  7888                                  
  7889                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7890                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  7891                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7892                                  		;pop	dx	; 13/12/2023
  7893                                  		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  7894                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  7895                                  unpackx:
  7896                                  		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  7897                                  		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  7898                                  		pop	dx ; * ; 13/12/2023
  7899                                  		pop	ds
  7900                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7901                                  		; (this is a fast kernel loading method by the MSDOS programmer)
  7902                                  		; ((consequtive clusters --> consequtive sectors))
  7903                                  		; ds = cs
  7904                                  		sub	si, bx
  7905                                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart? (consequtive?)
  7906                                  					; (current = previous+1)
  7907                                  		jnz	short getcl2	; no, read [doscnt] sectors 
  7908                                  		;add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7909                                  		add	[doscnt], cx ; 13/12/2023 ; add to read count
  7910                                  		jmp	short unpack
  7911                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7912                                  
  7913                                  getcl2:
  7914                                  		push	bx
  7915                                  		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  7916                                  		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  7917                                  
  7918                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7919                                  		; ds = cs
  7920                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7921                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  7922                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7923                                  		mov	cx, [doscnt]
  7924                                  
  7925                                  		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  7926                                  		;pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  7927                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7928                                  		pop	word [start_sec_h]
  7929                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  7930                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7931                                  		; ds = cs
  7932                                  		;push	ds
  7933                                  		;push	cs
  7934                                  		;pop	ds
  7935                                  
  7936                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7937                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7938                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7939                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7940                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7941                                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  7942                                  		
  7943                                  		;pop	ds
  7944                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7945                                  		; ds = cs
  7946                                  		pop	bx
  7947                                  		pop	di
  7948                                  
  7949                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  7950                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7951                                  		mov	ax, [doscnt]
  7952                                  		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  7953                                  		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  7954                                  		add	di, ax		; update load location
  7955                                  		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  7956                                  		retn
  7957                                  
  7958                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7959                                  
  7960                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  7961                                  ;
  7962                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  7963                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  7964                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  7965                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  7966                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  7967                                  ;
  7968                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  7969                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  7970                                  ;      other registera saved.
  7971                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  7972                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  7973                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  7974                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  7975                                  
  7976                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7977                                  get_fat_sector:	
  7978                                  		; 14/12/2023
  7979                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7980                                  		; ds = fat buffer segment
  7981                                  
  7982                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7983                                  		;push	ax ; (not necessary)
  7984                                  		push	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
  7985                                  		push	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
  7986                                  		push	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
  7987                                  		push	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
  7988                                  		push	ds ; FAT buffer segment
  7989                                  
  7990                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7991                                  		push	cs
  7992                                  		pop	ds
  7993                                  
  7994                                  		mov	ax, si
  7995                                  		;;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7996                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7997                                  		;mov	cx, [md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7998                                  		;div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  7999                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8000                                  		;nop
  8001                                  
  8002                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8003                                  		div	word [md_sectorsize] ; 512
  8004                                  
  8005                                  		; ax = FAT sector (sequence/index) number
  8006                                  		; dx = cluster number offset
  8007                                  
  8008                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  8009                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  8010                                  
  8011                                  		; 13/12/2023 ; *
  8012                                  		;push	es ; *
  8013                                  		;push	ds ; *
  8014                                  		;push	di ; *
  8015                                  		push	ax
  8016                                  		;push	cs ; *
  8017                                  		;pop	ds ; *
  8018                                  
  8019                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  8020                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8021                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id 
  8022                                  		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  8023                                  		;;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  8024                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  8025                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  8026                                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  8027                                  		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  8028                                  		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  8029                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  8030                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8031                                  		;pop	di ; *
  8032                                  		;pop	ds ; *
  8033                                  		;pop	es ; *
  8034                                  
  8035                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8036                                  		; ds = cs
  8037                                  		cmp	ax, [last_fat_sec_num]
  8038                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  8039                                  		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  8040                                  		mov	[last_fat_sec_num], ax
  8041                                  		;mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax
  8042                                  					; sector number
  8043                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  8044                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8045                                  		pop	es ; FAT buffer segment (DS on top of the stack)
  8046                                  		push	es ; (put it on top of the stack again)
  8047                                  
  8048                                  		push	dx ; cluster number offset
  8049                                  
  8050                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8051                                  		xor	cx, cx
  8052                                  		mov	[start_sec_h], cx ;0 
  8053                                  		;mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  8054                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  8055                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  8056                                  		mov	dx, ax
  8057                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8058                                  		inc	cx ; cx = 1
  8059                                  		;mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  8060                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  8061                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]
  8062                                  		;push	ds
  8063                                  		;pop	es
  8064                                  
  8065                                  		xor	di, di	; 0	; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  8066                                  		
  8067                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8068                                  		;push	ds
  8069                                  		;push	cs
  8070                                  		;pop	ds
  8071                                  		
  8072                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  8073                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  8074                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  8075                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  8076                                  		call	call_bios_code
  8077                                  
  8078                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8079                                  		;pop	ds
  8080                                  		; ds = cs = biosdata segment
  8081                                  
  8082                                  		pop	dx ; cluster number offset 
  8083                                  
  8084                                  gfs_split_chk:
  8085                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8086                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  8087                                  		mov	cx, [md_sectorsize]
  8088                                  ;gfs_split_chk:
  8089                                  		dec	cx		; 511
  8090                                  		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  8091                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  8092                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  8093                                  		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  8094                                  		
  8095                                  		; 13/12/2023
  8096                                  		; bx = dx = cluster number offset in the FAT buffer
  8097                                  		pop	ds ; FAT buffer segment
  8098                                  		pop	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
  8099                                  		pop	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
  8100                                  		pop	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
  8101                                  		pop	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
  8102                                  		;pop	ax
  8103                                  
  8104                                  		retn
  8105                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8106                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  8107                                  
  8108                                  %endif

  8113                                  		;db 0

  8117                                  
  8118                                  %if (numbertomod>0) & (numbertomod<16) ; 17/09/2023
  8119 00002128 00<rep 8h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  8120                                  %endif

  8124                                  ; 09/12/2022
  8125                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF equ $ - BData_start
  8126                                  ; 29/09/2023
  8127                                  ;IOSYSCODESEGOFF equ $-$$
  8128                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  8129                                  
  8130                                  ; 28/09/2023
  8131                                  S1SIZE equ $-$$
  8132                                  
  8133                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS data segment --------------------------------------------
  8134                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8135                                  		;db 4 dup(0)
  8136                                  ; 09/12/2022		
  8137                                  ;		times 4 db 0	; 19/10/2022

  8140                                  ;============================================================================
  8141                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) CODE SEGMENT 
  8142                                  ;============================================================================
  8143                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8144                                  
  8145                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0  
  8146                                  
  8147                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  8148                                   
  8149                                  ; 02/10/2022
  8150                                  
  8151                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  8152                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8153                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  8154                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8155                                  
  8156                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  8157 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  8158 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  8159                                  
  8160                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8161                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  8162                                  ; 09/12/2022
  8163                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  8164                                  
  8165                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8166                                  
  8167                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  8168                                  
  8169                                  ;************************************************************************
  8170                                  ;*									*
  8171                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  8172                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  8173                                  ;*									*
  8174                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  8175                                  ;*									*
  8176                                  ;************************************************************************
  8177                                  
  8178                                  	; 20/09/2023	
  8179                                  	; 10/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8180                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0032h 
  8181                                  
  8182                                  _seg_reinit:
  8183 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  8184                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  8185                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  8186 00000037 BF[B606]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  8187                                  		; 20/09/2023
  8188                                  		;mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  8189                                  		; 10/08/2023
  8190 0000003A B90300                  		mov	cx, 3 ; (PCDOS 7.1)
  8191                                  _seg_reinit_1:
  8192 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  8193 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  8194 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  8195 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  8196                                  
  8197                                  		; 10/08/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
  8198                                  		; (direct jump to i2f_handler from BIOSDATA:bios_i2f)
  8199                                  		; (instead of 'bcode_i2f: dw i2f_handler, IOSYSCODESEG')
  8200                                  		
  8201                                  		; 20/09/2023
  8202 00000042 26A3[0800]              		mov	[es:bios_i2f_seg], ax ; actual BIOSCODE segment
  8203                                  		
  8204 00000046 CB                      		retf
  8205                                  
  8206                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8207                                  
  8208                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8209                                  
  8210                                  ;************************************************************************
  8211                                  ;*									*
  8212                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  8213                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  8214                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  8215                                  ;*									*
  8216                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  8217                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  8218                                  ;*									*
  8219                                  ;************************************************************************
  8220                                  
  8221                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  8222 00000047 56                      		push	si
  8223 00000048 50                      		push	ax
  8224 00000049 51                      		push	cx
  8225 0000004A 52                      		push	dx
  8226 0000004B 57                      		push	di
  8227 0000004C 55                      		push	bp
  8228 0000004D 1E                      		push	ds
  8229 0000004E 06                      		push	es
  8230 0000004F 53                      		push	bx
  8231 00000050 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  8232 00000052 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  8233                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  8234                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  8235 00000055 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  8236                                  		; 20/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:005Ah)
  8237 0000005A C434                    		les	si, [si]
  8238                                  		;mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  8239 0000005C 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  8240 0000005E A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  8241 00000061 8826[E004]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  8242                                  		;mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  8243 00000065 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  8244 00000069 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  8245 0000006D 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  8246 00000071 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  8247 00000075 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  8248                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8249 00000079 81FE[3505]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  8250                                  		;;cmp	si, 579h	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8251                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  8252                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  8253 0000007D 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  8254                                  
  8255                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  8256                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  8257                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  8258                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  8259                                  ;
  8260                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  8261                                  ;
  8262                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  8263                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  8264                                  ;	  it has been used.
  8265                                  ;
  8266                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  8267                                  
  8268                                  		; 20/09/2023
  8269                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  8270 0000007F C706[1C05]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  8271 00000085 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  8272 00000088 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  8273 0000008A 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  8274                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  8275                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  8276 0000008E 8916[1C05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  8277 00000092 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  8278                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  8279                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  8280 00000096 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  8281 00000097 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  8282 0000009B 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, [cs:si]
  8283 0000009E 732B                    		jnb	short command_error
  8284 000000A0 98                      		cbw			; note that al <= 15 means ok
  8285 000000A1 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  8286 000000A3 01C6                    		add	si, ax
  8287 000000A5 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  8288 000000A6 26C47F0E                		les	di, [es:bx+14]	; [es:bx+trans]
  8289 000000AA FC                      		cld
  8290                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8291 000000AB 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  8292                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  8293 000000AF 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  8294 000000B1 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8295                                  already_got_ah_status:
  8296                                  		;;mov	ds, [cs:0030h]	; 15/10/2022
  8297                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  8298                                  					; cas note: shouldn't be needed!
  8299 000000B3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  8300                                  		;lds	bx, ds:ptrsav
  8301 000000B8 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
  8302 000000BC 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  8303                                  					; mark operation complete
  8304 000000BF 5B                      		pop	bx
  8305 000000C0 07                      		pop	es
  8306 000000C1 1F                      		pop	ds
  8307 000000C2 5D                      		pop	bp
  8308 000000C3 5F                      		pop	di
  8309 000000C4 5A                      		pop	dx
  8310 000000C5 59                      		pop	cx
  8311 000000C6 58                      		pop	ax
  8312 000000C7 5E                      		pop	si
  8313                                  		;add	sp, 2		; get rid of fake return address
  8314                                  		; 20/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1	- IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:00C8h)
  8315 000000C8 44                      		inc	sp
  8316 000000C9 44                      		inc	sp	
  8317                                  
  8318                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  8319                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  8320                                  bc_retf:
  8321 000000CA CB                      		retf
  8322                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8323                                  
  8324                                  command_error:				
  8325 000000CB E80700                  		call	bc_cmderr
  8326 000000CE EBE3                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  8327                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8328                                  ; 01/05/2019
  8329                                  
  8330                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8331                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  8332                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  8333                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  8334                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  8335                                  ; high.
  8336                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8337                                  
  8338                                  
  8339                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  8340                                  
  8341                                  		; 20/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
  8342                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0D0h)
  8343                                  		; 15/10/2022
  8344                                  		;dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  8345                                  
  8346 000000D0 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  8347                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  8348                                  		
  8349                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8350                                  
  8351                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  8352                                  
  8353                                  bc_cmderr:				
  8354 000000D5 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  8355                                  					; unknown command error
  8356                                  
  8357                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8358                                  
  8359                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  8360                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  8361                                  
  8362                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  8363                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  8364                                  
  8365                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  8366                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  8367                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8368 000000D7 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8369 000000DB 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  8370                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  8371 000000DF B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  8372 000000E1 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  8373 000000E2 C3                      		retn
  8374                                  
  8375                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8376                                  
  8377                                  ;Bios_Code ends
  8378
