 13626                                  
 13627                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13628                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13629                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13630                                  ;
 13631                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13632                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13633                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13634                                  ;	    drive)
 13635                                  ;
 13636                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13637                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13638                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13639                                  ;
 13640                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13641                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13642                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13643                                  ;
 13644                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13645                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13646                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13647                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13648                                  ;
 13649                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13650                                  ;
 13651                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13652                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13653                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13654                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13655                                  ; 
 13656                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13657                                  
 13658                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13659                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13660 000012D7 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13661 000012DB C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13662                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13663                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13664 000012DE 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13665 000012E0 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13666                                  		;
 13667 000012E2 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13668                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13669                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13670                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13671 000012E6 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13672                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13673 000012E8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13674 000012EA 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13675 000012EC FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13676                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13677 000012EE FEC8                    		dec	al
 13678 000012F0 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13679 000012F2 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13680 000012F4 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13681 000012F6 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13682 000012F8 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13683 000012FA 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13684 000012FC 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13685                                  GotMediaType:				
 13686 000012FE 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13687                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13688                                  		; cf = 0
 13689                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13690 00001301 C3                      		retn
 13691                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13692                                  
 13693                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13694 00001302 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13695 00001305 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13696 00001307 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13697 00001309 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13698 0000130C 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13699                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13700 0000130E B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13701                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13702 00001310 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13703 00001312 F9                      		stc
 13704 00001313 C3                      		retn
 13705                                  
 13706                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13707                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13708                                  		;db    0
 13709                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13710                                  
 13711                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13712                                  
 13713                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13714                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13715                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13716                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13717                                  
 13718                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13719                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13720                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13721                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13722                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13723                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13724                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13725                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13726                                  ;
 13727                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13728                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13729                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13730                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13731                                  ;
 13732                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13733                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13734                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13735                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13736                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13737                                  ;
 13738                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13739                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13740                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13741                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13742                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13743                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13744                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13745                                  
 13746                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13747                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13748                                  
 13749                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13750                                  
 13751                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13752 00001314 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13753 00001317 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13754 00001319 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13755 0000131C 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13756                                  
 13757                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13758                                  
 13759 0000131E 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13760 00001321 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13761 00001323 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13762 00001326 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13763 00001328 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13764                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13765                                  
 13766                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13767 0000132B CF                      		iret
 13768                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13769                                  
 13770                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13771 0000132C 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13772 0000132D 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13773                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13774                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13775                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13776 0000132F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13777                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13778                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13779                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13780                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13781                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13782                                  		
 13783                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13784                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13785 00001334 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13786                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13787 00001338 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13788                                  
 13789                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13790                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13791                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13792                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13793                                  		
 13794                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13795                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13796 0000133C 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13797 00001340 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13798                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13799                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13800 00001343 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13801 00001347 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13802                                  
 13803 0000134B 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13804                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13805                                  		;pop	bx
 13806 0000134C 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13807                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13808 0000134D 58                      		pop	ax
 13809                                  i2f_iret:
 13810 0000134E CF                      		iret

 14010                                  
 14011                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14012                                  
 14013                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14014                                  ;
 14015                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14016                                  ;
 14017                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14018                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14019                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14020                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14021                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14022                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14023                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14024                                  ;
 14025                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14026                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14027                                  ;
 14028                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14029                                  
 14030                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14031                                  HMAPtr:
 14032 0000140F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14033                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14034 00001414 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14035                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14036 00001418 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14037 0000141B 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14038 0000141D 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14039                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14040 00001422 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14041 00001424 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14042                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14043 00001428 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14044                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14045                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14046 0000142C C3                      		retn
 14047                                  
 14048                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14049                                  
 14050                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14051                                  
 14052                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14053                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14054                                  
 14055                                  move_sector:
 14056                                  
 14057                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14058                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14059                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14060                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14061                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14062                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14063                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14064                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14065                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14066                                  ;
 14067                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14068                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14069                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14070                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14071                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14072                                  
 14073 0000142D FC                      		cld
 14074 0000142E 51                      		push	cx
 14075 0000142F B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14076 00001432 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14077 00001436 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14078 00001438 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14079 0000143C 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14080 0000143E F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14081 00001440 59                      		pop	cx
 14082 00001441 C3                      		retn
 14083                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14084                                  
 14085                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14086 00001442 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14087 00001444 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14088 00001446 59                      		pop	cx
 14089 00001447 C3                      		retn
 14090                                  
 14091                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14092                                  
 14093                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14094                                  
 14095                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14096                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14097                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14098                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14099                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14100                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14101                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14102                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14103                                  ;
 14104                                  ; input conditions:
 14105                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14106                                  ;
 14107                                  ; output:
 14108                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14109                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14110                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14111                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14112                                  
 14113                                  check_wrap:	
 14114 00001448 50                      		push	ax
 14115 00001449 53                      		push	bx
 14116 0000144A 06                      		push	es
 14117 0000144B 57                      		push	di
 14118 0000144C E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14119 0000144F 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14120                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14121 00001451 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14122                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14123 00001456 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14124 00001458 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14125 0000145C 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14126 0000145E 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14127 00001461 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14128 00001463 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14129 00001465 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14130                                  
 14131                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14132                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14133                                  
 14134 00001467 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14135 00001469 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14136                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14137 0000146B 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14138 0000146C 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14139                                  					; if on	boundary
 14140                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14141                                  not_on_bound:
 14142 0000146E 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14143 00001471 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14144 00001473 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14145 00001475 40                      		inc	ax
 14146 00001476 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14147 00001478 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14148                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14149 0000147B 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14150 0000147F 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14151                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14152                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14153 00001481 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14154 00001483 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14155 00001484 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14156                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14157 00001486 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14158                                  
 14159                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14160                                  
 14161 00001488 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14162 0000148A 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14163 0000148C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14164                                  
 14165                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14166                                  
 14167 0000148E 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14168 00001490 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14169 00001492 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14170                                  no_head_bound:				
 14171 00001493 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14172 00001495 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14173 00001496 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14174 00001498 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14175 0000149A 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14176 0000149C 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14177 0000149F B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14178 000014A1 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14179 000014A3 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14180 000014A5 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14181 000014A7 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14182 000014A9 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14183 000014AB 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14184 000014AD 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14185                                  no_wrap:				
 14186 000014AF F8                      		clc
 14187 000014B0 5F                      		pop	di
 14188 000014B1 07                      		pop	es
 14189 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 14190 000014B3 58                      		pop	ax
 14191 000014B4 C3                      		retn
 14192                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14193                                  
 14194                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14195 000014B5 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14196 000014B7 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14197 000014B9 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14198                                  
 14199                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14200                                  
 14201                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14202                                  
 14203                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14204                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14205                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14206                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14207                                  ;
 14208                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14209                                  
 14210                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14211                                  find_bds:	
 14212 000014BB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14213                                  fbds_1:					
 14214 000014BF 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14215 000014C3 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14216 000014C5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14217                                  					; go to next bds
 14218 000014C8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14219 000014CB 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14220 000014CD F9                      		stc
 14221                                  fdbs_2:					
 14222 000014CE C3                      		retn
 14223                                  
 14224                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14225                                  
 14226                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14227                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14228                                  doint:
 14229                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14230 000014CF 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14231                                  					; get physical drive number
 14232                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14233                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14234                                  		
 14235 000014D2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14236 000014D4 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14237 000014D6 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14238                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14239 000014D8 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14240                                  					; get request code
 14241                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14242 000014DB FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14243                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14244 000014DE 9D                      		popf
 14245                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14246                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14247 000014DF 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14248                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14249                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14250 000014E4 9C                      		pushf
 14251                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14252 000014E5 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14253                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14254                                  dointdone:				
 14255 000014E8 C3                      		retn
 14256                                  
 14257                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14258                                  
 14259                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14260                                  
 14261                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14262                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14263                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14264                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14265                                  ;
 14266                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14267                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14268                                  ;
 14269                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14270                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14271                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14272                                  
 14273                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14274                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14275                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14276                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14277                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14278                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14279                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14280                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14281                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14282                                  ;end struc
 14283                                  
 14284                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14285                                  
 14286                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14287                                  ;	ah = function
 14288                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14289                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14290                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14291                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14292                                  ;   output conditions:
 14293                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14294                                  
 14295                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14296                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14297                                  ;
 14298                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14299                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14300                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14301                                  
 14302                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14303                                  
 14304                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14305                                  
 14306 000014E9 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14307                                  
 14308                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14309                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14310                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14311                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14312                                  
 14313                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14314                                  
 14315                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14316                                  
 14317                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14318                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14319                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14320                                  
 14321                                  format_special_stuff:
 14322 000014ED 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14323 000014F2 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14324 000014F4 53                      		push	bx
 14325 000014F5 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14326 000014F8 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14327 000014FB 5B                      		pop	bx
 14328 000014FC EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14329                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14330                                  
 14331                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14332                                  
 14333                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14334                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14335                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14336                                  
 14337                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14338                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14339 000014FE 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14340 00001500 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14341 00001502 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14342 00001503 51                      		push	cx
 14343 00001504 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14344 00001506 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14345 00001508 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14346 0000150A 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14347 0000150E 59                      		pop	cx
 14348 0000150F 58                      		pop	ax
 14349 00001510 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14350                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14351 00001512 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14352 00001513 06                      		push	es
 14353                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14354 00001514 2EC41E[E914]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14355                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14356                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14357 00001519 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14358 0000151B 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14359 0000151E 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14360                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14361                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14362 00001522 07                      		pop	es
 14363 00001523 5B                      		pop	bx
 14364 00001524 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14365                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14366                                  
 14367                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14368                                  
 14369                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14370                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14371                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14372                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14373                                  
 14374                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14375 00001526 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14376                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14377 0000152B 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14378 0000152D 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14379                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14380 00001532 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14381                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14382 00001534 50                      		push	ax
 14383 00001535 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14384                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14385                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14386 00001537 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14387                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14388                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14389 0000153C 58                      		pop	ax
 14390 0000153D EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14391                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14392                                  
 14393                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14394                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14395                                  
 14396                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14397                                  
 14398                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14399                                  
 14400                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14401                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14402                                  
 14403                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14404 0000153F 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14405                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14406                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14407 00001540 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14408                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14409                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14410                                  
 14411                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14412                                  
 14413 00001545 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14414 00001548 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14415 0000154B 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14416                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14417                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14418 0000154D 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14419 00001552 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14420                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14421                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14422                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14423 00001554 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14424                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14425                                  		
 14426 00001559 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14427                                  		
 14428 0000155A 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14429                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14430 0000155F 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14431                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14432                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14433 00001561 9D                      		popf
 14434 00001562 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14435                                  ret_from_i13:
 14436 00001564 1F                      		pop	ds
 14437 00001565 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14438                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14439                                  
 14440                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14441                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14442                                  ; a changeline error.
 14443                                  
 14444                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14445 00001568 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14446                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14447 0000156A 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14448 0000156D 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14449 0000156F 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14450 00001571 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14451 00001573 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14452 00001578 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14453                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14454                                  					; never	would
 14455 0000157A 53                      		push	bx
 14456 0000157B BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14457 0000157E E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14458 00001581 5B                      		pop	bx
 14459                                  int13b:
 14460 00001582 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14461 00001583 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14462                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14463                                  
 14464                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14465                                  
 14466                                  goterr13:
 14467 00001585 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14468 00001588 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14469                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 14470 0000158A 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14471 0000158D 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14472 0000158F 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14473 00001594 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14474                                  
 14475 00001596 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14476                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14477                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14478                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14479 0000159B 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14480                                  
 14481 0000159D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14482                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14483                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14484 0000159F 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14485                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14486                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14487 000015A4 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14488 000015A7 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14489 000015A9 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14490 000015AB 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14491 000015AD 53                      		push	bx
 14492 000015AE 51                      		push	cx
 14493 000015AF 52                      		push	dx
 14494 000015B0 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14495                                  loop_ecc:
 14496 000015B3 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14497                                  
 14498                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14499                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14500                                  ;
 14501                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14502                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14503                                  ; track.
 14504                                  ;
 14505                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14506                                  ; this request.
 14507                                  ;
 14508                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14509                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14510                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14511                                  ;
 14512 000015B6 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14513                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14514                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14515 000015B9 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14516                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14517 000015BE 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14518 000015C0 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14519 000015C3 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14520 000015C5 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14521 000015C8 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14522                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14523                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14524                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14525 000015CA 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14526                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14527                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14528                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14529                                  ok11_op:
 14530 000015CC FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14531 000015D0 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14532 000015D2 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14533                                  					; add 200h to address
 14534 000015D4 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14535 000015D6 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14536 000015D8 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14537                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14538                                  
 14539                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14540                                  
 14541                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14542 000015DA F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14543                                  ok11_exit:
 14544 000015DB 5A                      		pop	dx
 14545 000015DC 59                      		pop	cx
 14546 000015DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14547 000015DE EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14548                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14549                                  
 14550                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14551                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14552                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14553                                  
 14554                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14555 000015E0 06                      		push	es
 14556 000015E1 53                      		push	bx
 14557 000015E2 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14558 000015E5 1E                      		push	ds
 14559 000015E6 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14560 000015E7 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14561                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14562                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14563 000015EA 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14564                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14565 000015EF 5B                      		pop	bx
 14566 000015F0 07                      		pop	es
 14567 000015F1 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14568 000015F3 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14569 000015F6 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14570                                  
 14571                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14572                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14573                                  
 14574                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14575 000015F8 56                      		push	si
 14576 000015F9 57                      		push	di
 14577 000015FA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14578 000015FC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14579 000015FF E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14580 00001602 5F                      		pop	di
 14581 00001603 5E                      		pop	si
 14582 00001604 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14583                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14584                                  
 14585                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14586                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14587                                  
 14588                                  gotdmaerr:
 14589 00001606 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14590 00001609 FB                      		sti
 14591 0000160A 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14592 0000160D 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14593                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14594                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14595 0000160F 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14596 00001612 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14597 00001614 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14598 00001617 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14599 00001619 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14600                                  
 14601                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14602                                  
 14603                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14604                                  
 14605 0000161B 52                      		push	dx
 14606 0000161C 51                      		push	cx
 14607 0000161D 53                      		push	bx
 14608 0000161E 50                      		push	ax
 14609 0000161F 55                      		push	bp
 14610 00001620 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14611 00001622 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14612 00001624 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14613 00001626 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14614 00001628 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14615 0000162A D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14616 0000162C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14617 0000162E 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14618                                  
 14619                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14620                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14621                                  
 14622 00001632 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14623 00001634 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14624                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14625                                  
 14626                                  no_skip_first:
 14627 00001637 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14628 00001639 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14629 0000163B 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14630                                  
 14631                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14632                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14633                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14634                                  ;
 14635                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14636                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14637                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14638                                  ; in error.
 14639                                  
 14640 0000163D 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14641 0000163F 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14642                                  
 14643                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14644                                  
 14645 00001641 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14646                                  					; set up head number
 14647 00001644 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14648 00001647 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14649                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14650                                  
 14651                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14652 0000164A B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14653 0000164C F9                      		stc
 14654 0000164D E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14655                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14656                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14657                                  
 14658                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14659                                  
 14660                                  intverify:
 14661 00001650 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14662 00001651 53                      		push	bx
 14663 00001652 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14664 00001653 07                      		pop	es
 14665                                  dosimple:
 14666 00001654 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14667                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14668                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14669                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14670 00001657 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14671                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14672 0000165C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14673 0000165D 07                      		pop	es
 14674 0000165E E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14675                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14676                                  
 14677                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14678                                  
 14679                                  intformat:
 14680 00001661 06                      		push	es
 14681 00001662 53                      		push	bx
 14682 00001663 56                      		push	si
 14683 00001664 57                      		push	di
 14684 00001665 1E                      		push	ds
 14685                                  
 14686                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14687                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14688                                  
 14689 00001666 06                      		push	es
 14690 00001667 1E                      		push	ds
 14691 00001668 07                      		pop	es
 14692 00001669 1F                      		pop	ds
 14693 0000166A 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14694 0000166C BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14695 0000166F E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14696 00001672 1F                      		pop	ds
 14697 00001673 5F                      		pop	di
 14698 00001674 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14699 00001675 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14700                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14701                                  
 14702                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14703                                  ; the first block.
 14704                                  ;
 14705                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14706                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14707                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14708                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14709                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14710                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14711                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14712                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14713                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14714                                  
 14715                                  doblock:
 14716                                  
 14717                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14718                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14719                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14720                                  				
 14721 00001677 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14722                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14723 0000167A 51                      		push	cx
 14724 0000167B 06                      		push	es
 14725 0000167C 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14726                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14727 0000167D E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14728 00001680 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14729                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14730 00001684 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14731                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14732 00001689 5F                      		pop	di
 14733 0000168A 07                      		pop	es
 14734 0000168B 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14735 0000168D 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14736 0000168F B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14737 00001691 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14738                                  doblockflop:
 14739 00001693 59                      		pop	cx
 14740                                  doblockcontinue:
 14741 00001694 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14742 00001696 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14743 00001698 50                      		push	ax
 14744 00001699 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14745 0000169B EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14746                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14747                                  
 14748                                  doblocklast:
 14749 0000169D 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14750 0000169F 50                      		push	ax
 14751                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 14752 000016A0 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14753 000016A3 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14754 000016A5 58                      		pop	ax
 14755 000016A6 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14756                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14757 000016A9 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14758 000016AB 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14759 000016AD 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14760 000016AF 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14761 000016B1 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14762                                  					; then we are done already.
 14763 000016B3 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14764                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14765 000016B5 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14766 000016B8 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14767                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14768                                  
 14769                                  bufferx:
 14770 000016BA 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14771                                  					; set up head number
 14772                                  buffer:
 14773 000016BD 53                      		push	bx
 14774 000016BE 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14775 000016C1 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14776 000016C4 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14777                                  
 14778                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14779                                  
 14780 000016C6 06                      		push	es
 14781 000016C7 1E                      		push	ds
 14782 000016C8 56                      		push	si
 14783 000016C9 57                      		push	di
 14784 000016CA 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14785 000016CB 06                      		push	es
 14786 000016CC 1F                      		pop	ds
 14787 000016CD 07                      		pop	es
 14788 000016CE BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14789 000016D1 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14790 000016D2 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14791 000016D4 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14792 000016D7 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14793                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14794 000016D8 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14795 000016D9 5E                      		pop	si
 14796 000016DA 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14797                                  
 14798                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14799                                  
 14800 000016DB B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14801                                  					; get drive number
 14802 000016DD 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14803 000016E0 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14804                                  					;
 14805                                  					; ah is	function
 14806                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14807                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14808                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14809                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14810                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14811 000016E3 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14812 000016E6 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14813 000016E7 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14814 000016E9 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14815                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14816                                  
 14817                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14818                                  
 14819                                  doread:
 14820 000016EB 06                      		push	es
 14821 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 14822 000016ED 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14823 000016EE 07                      		pop	es
 14824 000016EF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14825 000016F2 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14826 000016F4 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14827                                  					; get drive number
 14828 000016F7 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14829                                  					; ah = function
 14830                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14831                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14832                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14833 000016FA E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14834 000016FD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14835 000016FE 07                      		pop	es
 14836 000016FF 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14837 00001701 56                      		push	si
 14838 00001702 57                      		push	di
 14839 00001703 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14840 00001705 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14841 00001708 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14842 0000170B 5F                      		pop	di
 14843 0000170C 5E                      		pop	si
 14844                                  
 14845                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14846                                  
 14847                                  dotail:
 14848 0000170D 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14849 0000170E 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14850 00001711 41                      		inc	cx
 14851 00001712 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14852 00001715 F8                      		clc
 14853 00001716 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14854 00001718 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14855                                  
 14856                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14857                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14858                                  
 14859 0000171A 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14860 0000171D E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14861 00001720 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14862                                  
 14863                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14864                                  
 14865                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14866                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14867                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14868                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14869                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14870                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14871                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14872                                  
 14873                                  bad13:
 14874 00001723 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14875 00001725 5D                      		pop	bp
 14876 00001726 5B                      		pop	bx
 14877 00001727 5B                      		pop	bx
 14878 00001728 59                      		pop	cx
 14879 00001729 5A                      		pop	dx
 14880 0000172A 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14881 0000172C E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14882                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14883                                  
 14884                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 14885 0000172F E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14886                                  
 14887                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14888                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14889                                  		;db 	0
 14890                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14891                                  
 14892                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14911                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14912                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14913                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14914                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14915                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14916                                  
 14917                                  install_bds:
 14918 0000173E 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14919 0000173F BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14920                                  
 14921                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14922                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14923                                  loop_next_bds:
 14924 00001742 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14925                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14926 00001744 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14927 00001748 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14928                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14929 0000174B 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14930 0000174D B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14931 0000174F 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14932                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14933 00001753 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14934 00001756 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14935                                  					; we don't own it
 14936 0000175B 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14937                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14938 0000175E 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14939 00001761 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14940                                  next_bds:
 14941                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14942 00001765 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14943 00001768 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14944                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14945                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14946 0000176A 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14947 0000176C 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14948                                  					; install bds
 14949 0000176F 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14950 00001771 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14951                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14952                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14953 00001774 1F                      		pop	ds

 14999                                  no_win386:				
 15000 0000178F 51                      		push	cx
 15001 00001790 52                      		push	dx
 15002 00001791 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 15003                                  					; get the drive	letter

 15006                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
