 19896                                  	;jc	short LdngLo		; If that don't work...
 19897                                  	;retn
 19898                                  	; 18/12/2022
 19899 0000093A 731C                    	jnc	short LoadDosHi_ok
 19900                                  LdngLo:
 19901                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19902                                  	;push	cs

 19907 0000093E BA[E408]                	mov	dx,DOSLOMSG		; inform user that we are

 19909

 19911                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.

 19939                                  ;
 19940                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19941                                  ;
 19942                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19943                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19944                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19945                                  ;
 19946                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19947                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19948                                  ; 
 19949                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19950                                  
 19951                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19952                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 19953                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 19954                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19955                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19956                                  	; ds = cs
 19957 00000959 E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 19958 0000095C 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19959                                  
 19960                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19961                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19962                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19963                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19964                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19965                                  	; ds = cs
 19966 0000095E 8E06[7302]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19967                                  ;else
 19968                                  ;	..
 19969                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19970                                  
 19971                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19972                                  	; ds = cs
 19973 00000962 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 19974                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 19975 00000964 FF1E[7D02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 19976                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 19977 00000968 C606[6C02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 19978 0000096D F8                      	clc
 19979                                  ttldhx:
 19980 0000096E C3                      	retn

 19988                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.

 19990                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed

 20000 00000972 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; no
 20001 00000974 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh

 20003

 20006                                  
 20007                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA

 20012

 20014

 20016                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20017                                  	;xor	di,di
 20018                                  	
 20019                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20020                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 20021                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20022                                  	; ds = cs

 20024 00000980 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it

 20321                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20322                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20323                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20324                                  	; ds = cs
 20325                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end
 20326                                  	;sub	ax,BCode_start		; BIOS code size
 20327                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20329                                  					; 30/12/2022

 20331                                  	; 09/12/2022

 20339 000009DA 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20340 000009DD E86302                  	call	off_to_para			; convert to para
 20341                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20342                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20343                                  	;inc	ax ; + 1 paragraph for MCB
 20344 000009E0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 20345 000009E2 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 20346 000009E4 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 20347 000009E6 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 20348 000009E8 CD21                    	int	21h
 20349 000009EA 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 20350                                   	; 23/10/2022
 20351                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 20352 000009EC 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 20353                                  						;  BIOS code

 20355                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 20356                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 20357                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20358                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 20359                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 20360                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20361 000009F1 26C70621000800          	mov	word [es:20h+1],08h		; mark it as system
 20362 000009F8 26C70628005343          	mov	word [es:20h+8],'SC'		;  code area
 20363                                  
 20364 000009FF C3                      	retn
 20365                                  
 20366                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20367                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20368                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20369                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20370                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20371                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20372                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20373                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20374                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20375                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20376                                  ;	  stub will go.

 20443                                  ;
 20444                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20445                                  ;
 20446                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20447                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20448                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20449                                  ;
 20450                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20451                                  ;
 20452                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20453                                  
 20454                                  AllocHMA:
 20455                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20456                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20457                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20458                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20459                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20460                                  
 20461                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20462                                  ;
 20463                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20464                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20465                                  ;	push	ax
 20466                                  ;	popf
 20467                                  ;	pushf
 20468                                  ;	pop	ax
 20469                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20470                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20471                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20472                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20473                                  
 20474                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20475                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)

 20490                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20491

 20613                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20614                                  ;
 20615                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20616                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20617                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20618                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20619                                  ;
 20620                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20621                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20622                                  ;
 20623                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20624                                  
 20625                                  StartVDHead:
 20626                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20627                                  
 20628 00000AC0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20629 00000AC4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20630 00000AC6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20631 00000AC8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20632 00000ACA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20633                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20634 00000ACB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20635                                  VDiskSig1:
 20636 00000AD2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20637                                  
 20638                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20639                                  
 20640 00000AD7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20641                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20642 00000ADD 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20643 00000AEC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20644 00000AEE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20645                                  VDInt19:
 20646 00000AEF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20647                                  OldVDInt19:
 20648 00000AF0 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20649                                  
 20650                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20651                                  
 20652                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20653 00000AF4 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20654                                  VDiskSig2:
 20655 00000AF7 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20656                                  
 20657                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20658                                  
 20659 00000AFC 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20660 00000AFF 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20661 00000B01 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20662 00000B02 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20663 00000B04 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20664 00000B05 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20665 00000B07 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20666 00000B09 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20667 00000B0A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20668 00000B0C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20669 00000B0E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20670 00000B10 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20671 00000B12 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20672                                  
 20673                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20675                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20676                                  ;
 20677                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20678                                  ;
 20679                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20680                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20681                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20682                                  ;
 20683                                  ; Inputs : None
 20684                                  ;
 20685                                  ; Outputs : None
 20686                                  ;
 20687                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20688                                  ;
 20689                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20690                                  
 20691                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20692                                  
 20693                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20694 00000B14 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20695 00000B16 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20696                                  
 20697                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20698                                  
 20699                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20700 00000B18 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20701                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20702 00000B1B 2EA3[F00A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20703 00000B1F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20704                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20705 00000B22 2EA3[F20A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20706                                  
 20707                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20708                                  
 20709 00000B26 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20710                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20711                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20712 00000B28 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20713 00000B2B CD21                    	int	21h
 20714                                  
 20715                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20716                                  
 20717 00000B2D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20718 00000B2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20719                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20720 00000B30 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20721                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20722 00000B37 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20723 00000B3E 40                      	inc	ax
 20724 00000B3F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20725                                  
 20726                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20727                                  
 20728 00000B41 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20729                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20730 00000B42 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20731 00000B48 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20732                                  
 20733                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20734                                  
 20735                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20736 00000B4B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20737 00000B4E BE[C00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20738 00000B51 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20739 00000B53 0E                      	push	cs
 20740 00000B54 1F                      	pop	ds
 20741 00000B55 FC                      	cld
 20742 00000B56 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20743 00000B58 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20744                                  
 20745                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20746                                  
 20747                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20748 00000B59 57                      	push	di
 20749 00000B5A 06                      	push	es
 20750                                  
 20751                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20752                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20753                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20754 00000B5B 49                      	dec	cx
 20755                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20756 00000B5C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20757

 20763                                  
 20764 00000B69 5F                      	pop	di
 20765 00000B6A 07                      	pop	es

 20818                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20819                                  
 20820                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20821                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20822                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20823                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20824                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20825                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20826                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20827                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20828                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20829                                  ;								     ;I070
 20830                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20831                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20832                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20833                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20834                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20835                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20836                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20837                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20838                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20839                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20840                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20841                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20842                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20843                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20844                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20845                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20846                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20847                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20848                                  
 20849                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20850                                  	; ds = cs
 20851                                  
 20852                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20853                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20854                                  
 20855 00000BBC 06                      	push	es
 20856 00000BBD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20857 00000BBF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20858 00000BC1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20859 00000BC3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20860 00000BC5 B104                    	mov	cl,4

 20892                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.

 20894                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20895                                  ;		the offset.

 20977                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20978                                  ;
 20979                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20993 00000C3C B105                    	mov	cl,5

 20995 00000C3F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0

 21917                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21918                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21919                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21920                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21921                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21922                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21923                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21924                                  ;
 21925                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21926                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21927                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21928                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21929                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21930                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21931                                  ;
 21932                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21933                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21934                                  ;
 21935                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21936                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21937                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21938                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21939                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21940                                  ;
 21941                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21942                                  ;
 21943                                  ;			  none.
 21944                                  
 21945                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21946                                  ;
 21947                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21948                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21949                                  
 21950                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21951

 22153                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22154                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22155                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22156                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22157                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22158                                  ;
 22159                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22160                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22161                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22162                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22163                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22164                                  ; program).
 22165                                  
 22166                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22167                                  
 22168                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22169                                  
 22170 000010B3 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22171                                  
 22172                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22173                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22174                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22175                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22176                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22177                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22178                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22179                                  ; carridge return.
 22180                                  
 22181                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22182                                  ;character after =.
 22183                                  
 22184 000010B4 06                      	push	es
 22185 000010B5 1E                      	push	ds
 22186 000010B6 07                      	pop	es
 22187 000010B7 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22188 000010B8 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22189                                  
 22190 000010BA 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22191 000010BC FC                      	cld
 22192 000010BD 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22193 000010C3 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm

 22329                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22330                                  ;
 22331                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22332                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22333                                  ;
 22334                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22335                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22336                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22337                                  
 22338                                  ParaRound:
 22339 0000112F 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22340 00001132 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22341 00001134 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22342 00001136 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22343 00001138 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22344 0000113A C3                      	retn

 22346                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22347                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22348                                  ;
 22349                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22350                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22351                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22352                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22353                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22354                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22355                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22356                                  ;
 22357                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22358                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22359                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22360                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22361                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22362                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22363                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 22364                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22365                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22366                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22367                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22368                                  ;
 22369                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22370                                  
 22371                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22372                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22373                                  sysinit_base:				
 22374 0000113B 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22375 00001140 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22376 00001145 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22377 00001147 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22378 0000114C 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22379 00001151 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22380 00001152 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22381 00001153 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22382                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22383                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22384 00001155 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22385 00001158 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22386 0000115D 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22387                                  
 22388                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22389                                  
 22390 0000115F B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22391 00001161 0E                      	push	cs
 22392 00001162 1F                      	pop	ds
 22393                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22394                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22395                                  	;mov	dx,102
 22396 00001163 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22397                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22398 00001166 CD21                    	int	21h
 22399                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22400                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22401                                  
 22402                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22403                                  stall:
 22404                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22405                                  _stall: 
 22406                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22407 00001168 F4                      	hlt 
 22408                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22409                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22410 00001169 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22411                                  
 22412                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22413 0000116B 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22414                                  
 22415                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22416                                  
 22417                                  sum_up:
 22418                                  
 22419                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22420                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22421                                  ;
 22422                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22423                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22424                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22425                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22426                                  ;
 22427                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22428                                  
 22429 00001170 1E                      	push	ds
 22430                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22431                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22432 00001171 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22433                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22434                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22435 00001175 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22436 00001177 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22437 00001179 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22438 0000117B 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22439                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22440 00001180 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22441 00001182 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22442                                  sum1:
 22443 00001184 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22444 00001186 46                      	inc	si
 22445 00001187 46                      	inc	si
 22446 00001188 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22447                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22448                                  sum_sys_code:
 22449                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22450 0000118A BE8A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22451                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22452                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22453                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22454                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22455                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22456                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22457                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22458 0000118D B9[504D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22459 00001190 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22460 00001192 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22461                                  sum2:
 22462 00001194 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22463 00001197 46                      	inc	si
 22464 00001198 46                      	inc	si
 22465 00001199 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22466 0000119B 1F                      	pop	ds
 22467 0000119C C3                      	retn
 22468                                  
 22469                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22470                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22471                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22472                                  
 22473                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22474                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h)

 22478 0000119F 0000                    	dw	0

 22493                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22494                                  ;
 22495                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22496                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22497                                  ;
 22498                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22499                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22500                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22501                                  ;
 22502                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22503                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22504                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 22569                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22570                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22571                                  ;
 22572                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22573                                  ;
 22574                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22575                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22576                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22577                                  
 22578                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22579                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22580 00001216 53                      	push	bx
 22581 00001217 52                      	push	dx
 22582 00001218 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22583 0000121C 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22584                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22585 00001221 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22586                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22587                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22588                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22589 00001224 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22590 00001226 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22591 00001228 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22592                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22593 0000122B CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; DOS 5+ - ALLOCATE HMA SPACE
 22594                                  			;     AX = 4A02h
 22595                                  			;     BX = number of bytes
 22596                                  			; Return:
 22597                                  			;     ES:DI -> start of allocated HMA block or FFFFh:FFFFh
 22598                                  			;     BX = number of bytes actually allocated
 22599                                  			;	   (rounded up to next paragraph)
 22600                                  			; Notes:
 22601                                  			;     this call is not valid unless DOS is loaded in the HMA
 22602                                  			;     (DOS=HIGH)
 22603                                  
 22604 0000122D 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22605 00001230 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22606                                  
 22607                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22608                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22609                                  	; zf=1
 22610 00001232 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22611                                  	; zf=1
 22612                                  	
 22613                                  	;zf=1
 22614                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22615                                  	;zf=1
 22616 00001233 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22617                                  got_hma:
 22618 00001238 5A                      	pop	dx
 22619 00001239 5B                      	pop	bx
 22620 0000123A C3                      	retn
 22621

 22637 00001240 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22638 00001244 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22639 00001248 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; adjust ax
 22640                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22641 0000124D 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 22642                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 22643 00001250 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22644                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22645 00001256 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22646                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22647 0000125C 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22648 00001262 C3                      	retn
 22649                                  
 22650                                  ; ======================================================================
 22651                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22652                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22653                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22654                                  
 22655                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22656                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22657                                  ;
 22658                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22659                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22660                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22661                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22662                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22663                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22664                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22665                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22666                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22667                                  ;
 22668                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22669                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22670                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22671                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22672                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22673                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22674                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22675                                  ;	conditions:
 22676                                  ;
 22677                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22678                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22679                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22680                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22681                                  ;
 22682                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22683                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22684                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22685                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22686                                  ;
 22687                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22688                                  ;
 22689                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22690                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22691                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22692                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22693                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22694                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22695                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22696                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22697                                  ;
 22698                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22699                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22700                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22701                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22702                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 22703                                  ;
 22704                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22705                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22706                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22707                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22708                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22709                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22710                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22711                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22712                                  ;
 22713                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22714                                  
 22715                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22716                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22717                                  
 22718                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22719                                  stackinit:
 22720 00001263 50                      	push	ax
 22721 00001264 1E                      	push	ds
 22722 00001265 06                      	push	es
 22723 00001266 53                      	push	bx
 22724 00001267 51                      	push	cx
 22725 00001268 52                      	push	dx
 22726 00001269 57                      	push	di
 22727 0000126A 56                      	push	si
 22728 0000126B 55                      	push	bp
 22729                                  
 22730                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22731                                  
 22732                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22733                                  	; ds = cs
 22734 0000126C A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22735 0000126F 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22736                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22737                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22738                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22739 00001271 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22740                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22741 00001275 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22742 00001278 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22743                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22744 0000127C A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22745                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22746                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22747                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22748 0000127F 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22749                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22750 00001283 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22751 00001285 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]

 22753                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22754                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22755 00001288 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22756                                  
 22757                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22758                                  
 22759                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22760                                  
 22761                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22762                                  	; 12/12/2022

 22764 0000128C 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp

 22767                                  
 22768 00001291 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8

 22772 00001294 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22773 00001296 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22774 00001298 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22775 0000129C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22776 0000129E 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22777                                  
 22778                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22779                                  
 22780 000012A1 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22781 000012A6 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22782 000012AA F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22783 000012AC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22784 000012AE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22785 000012B0 06                      	push	es
 22786 000012B1 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22787                                  
 22788                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22789                                  
 22790 000012B2 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22791 000012B6 FC                      	cld
 22792 000012B7 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22793                                  
 22794 000012B9 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22795                                  
 22796                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22797                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22798                                  ;  cx = number of entries

 22800                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 23557                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23558                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23559                                  
 23560                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23561                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23562                                  
 23563                                  ; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23564                                  ; (SYSINIT:1745h)
 23565                                  
 23566                                  new_init_loop:
 23567                                  
 23568                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23569                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23570                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23571                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23572                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23573                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23574                                  
 23575                                  ; 13/04/2024
 23576                                  %if 0
 23577                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23578                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23579                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23580                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23581                                  
 23582                                  	push	ds
 23583                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23584                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23585                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23586                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23587                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23588                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23589                                  	mov	[di],ax
 23590                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23591                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23592                                  	pop	ds
 23593                                  %else
 23594                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23595 00001455 1E                      	push	ds
 23596 00001456 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23597 0000145A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23598 0000145D 50                      	push	ax
 23599 0000145E 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23600 00001461 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23601 00001463 50                      	push	ax
 23602 00001464 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23603 00001467 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23604 00001469 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 23605 0000146A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23606 0000146C 58                      	pop	ax
 23607 0000146D 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23608 00001470 1F                      	pop	ds
 23609                                  %endif
 23610 00001471 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23611 00001474 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23612 00001478 C3                      	retn
 23613                                  
 23614                                  
 23615                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23618                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23619                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23620                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23621                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23622                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23623                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23624                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23625                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23626                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23627                                  
 23628                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23629                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23630                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23631                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23632                                  
 23633                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 23634                                  
 23635                                  setdevmark:
 23636                                  
 23637                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23638                                  	;push	es
 23639                                  	;push	cx
 23640                                  
 23641 00001479 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23642 0000147E 2E890E[9C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23643 00001483 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23644                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23645                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23646 00001485 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23647 00001489 41                      	inc	cx
 23648                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23649 0000148A 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23650                                  
 23651                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23652                                  	;pop	cx
 23653                                  	;pop	es
 23654                                  	
 23655 0000148F 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23656 00001494 C3                      	retn

 23699                                  ;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 23700                                  ;
 23701                                  ;   config_envlen must immediately precede config_wrkseg, because they
 23702                                  ;   may be loaded as a dword ptr
 23703                                  
 23704                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23705                                  ; 25/10/2022
 23706 00001495 0000                    config_envlen:	dw  0  			; when config_wrkseg is being used as
 23707                                                 				;  a scratch env, this is its length
 23708 00001497 0000                    config_wrkseg:	dw  0			; config work area (above confbot)
 23709                                                     			;  segment of work area
 23710

 23858                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23859                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23860                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23861                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23862                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23863                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23864                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23865                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23866                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23867                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23868                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23869                                  
 23870                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23871                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk

 23874 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23875                                  endstruc

 23887                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
