 23895                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23896                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23897 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23898 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23899 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23900                                  endstruc
 23901                                  
 23902                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23903                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23904                                  ;
 23905                                  ;
 23906                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23907                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23908                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23909                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23910                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23911                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23912                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23913                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23914                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23915                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23916                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23917                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23918                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23919                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23920                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23921                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23922                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23923                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23924                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23925                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23926                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23927                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23928                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23929                                  ;	   :
 23930                                  ;
 23931                                  ;Note:
 23932                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23933                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23934                                  ;
 23935                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23936                                  ;
 23937                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23938                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23939                                  ;
 23940                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23941                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23942                                  ;
 23943                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23944                                  ;
 23945                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23946                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23947                                  ;
 23948                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23949                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23950                                  ;
 23951                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23952                                  ;
 23953                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23954                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23955                                  ;
 23956                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23957                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23958                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23959                                  ;
 23960                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23961                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23962                                  ;
 23963                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23964                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23965                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23966                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23967                                  
 23968                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23969                                  
 23970                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23971                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23972                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23973                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23974                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23975                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23976                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23977                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23978                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23979                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23980                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23981                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23982                                  
 23983                                  ;**** Function flags
 23984                                  
 23985                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23986                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23987                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23988                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23989                                  
 23990                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23991                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23992 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23993 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23994 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23995 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23996 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23997 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23998                                  endstruc
 23999                                  
 24000                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24001                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24002                                  ;
 24003                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24004                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24005                                  ;	     +-
 24006                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24007                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24008                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24009                                  ;	     |	:
 24010                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24011                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24012                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24013                                  ;	     |	:
 24014                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24015                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24016                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24017                                  ;	     +-	:
 24018                                  ;
 24019                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24020                                  ;
 24021                                  ;Note:
 24022                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24023                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24024                                  ;
 24025                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24026                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24027                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24028                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24029                                  
 24030                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24031                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24032                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24033                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24034                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24035                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24036                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24037                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24038                                  
 24039                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24040 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24041 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24042 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24043 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24044 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24045                                  endstruc
 24046                                  
 24047                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24048                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24049                                  ;
 24050                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24051                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24052                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24053                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24054                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24055                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24056                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24057                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24058                                  ;
 24059                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24060                                  ;
 24061                                  ;            +-
 24062                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24063                                  ;	    | or
 24064                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24065                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24066                                  ;	    | or
 24067                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24068                                  ;	    | or
 24069                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24070                                  ;	    | or
 24071                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24072                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24073                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24074                                  ;	    | or
 24075                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24076                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24077                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24078                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24079                                  ;	    +-
 24080                                  ;
 24081                                  ;
 24082                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24083                                  ;      list.
 24084                                  ;
 24085                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24086                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24087                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24088                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24089                                  
 24090                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24091                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24092 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24093 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24094 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24095 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24096                                  endstruc
 24097

 24104                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String

 24107                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 24108                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 24109                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 24110                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 24111

 24115                                  ;

 24117

 24119                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 24120                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 24121                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24122                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24123                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24124                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24125                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24126                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24127                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24140 000014AF 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_SEG:	   dw	0		;AN000; Segment of DBCS EV
 24141 000014B1 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 24142                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags

 24213                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24214                                  ; SysParse;
 24215                                  ;
 24216                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24217                                  ;
 24218                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24219                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24220                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24221                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24222                                  ;
 24223                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24224                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24225                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24226                                  ;
 24227                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24228                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24229                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24230                                  ;
 24231                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24232                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24233                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24234                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24235                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24236                                  ;
 24237                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24238                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24239                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24240                                  ;
 24241                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24242                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24243                                  ;
 24244                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24245                                  ;
 24246                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24247                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24248                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24249                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24250                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24251                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24252                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24253                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24254                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24255                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24256                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24257                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24258                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24259                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24260                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24261                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24262                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24263                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24264                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24265                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24266                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24267                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24268                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24269                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24270                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24271                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24272                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24273                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24274                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24275                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24276                                  
 24277                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24278                                  
 24279                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24280                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24281                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24282                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24283                                  
 24284                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24285                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24286                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24287                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24288                                  ;
 24289                                  
 24290                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24291                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24292                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24293                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24294                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24295                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24296                                  
 24297                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24298                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24299                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24300                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24301                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24302                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24303                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24304                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24305                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24306                                  
 24307                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24308                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24309                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24310                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24311                                  ;	     segment.
 24312                                  
 24313                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24314                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24315                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24316                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24317                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24318                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24319                                  
 24320                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 24321                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24322                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 24323                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 24324

 24326                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT

 24329                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 24330                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 24331                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.

 24333                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 24334                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 24335                                  
 24336                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 24337                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 24338                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 24339                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 24340

 24342                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 24343

 24913                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24914                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24915                                  ;
 24916                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24917                                  ;
 24918                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24919                                  ;	    AL = type
 24920                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24921                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24922                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24923                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24924                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24925                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24926                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24927                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24928                                  ;
 24929                                  ; Output:   None
 24930                                  ;
 24931                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24932                                  ;
 24933                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24934                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24935                                  
 24936                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24937 0000175C 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24938 0000175D 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24939                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer

 24941                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24942                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24943                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24944                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax

 24946

 24949 0000176E 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24950                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24951 00001772 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;

 25152                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 25153                                  ;
 25154                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 25155                                  ;
 25156                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 25157                                  ;
 25158                                  ; Output:   None
 25159                                  ;
 25160                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 25161                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25162                                  
 25163                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 25164 00001889 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25165 0000188A 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25166                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 25167 0000188B 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25168 0000188E 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25169 00001890 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 25170                                  
 25171 00001892 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 25172 00001894 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 25173                                  
 25174 00001896 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 25175 0000189B 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 25176                                  
 25177 0000189D 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 25178 000018A1 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 25179                                  
 25180                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 25181 000018A3 E80E04                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 25182 000018A6 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 25183                                  
 25184 000018A8 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 25185                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 25186 000018A9 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 25187 000018AA EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25188                                  
 25189                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 25190 000018AC 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25191 000018AD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25192 000018AE C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25194                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25195                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 25196                                  ;
 25197                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 25198                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 25199                                  ;
 25200                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 25201                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 25202                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 25203                                  ;
 25204                                  ; Output:   None
 25205                                  ;
 25206                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 25207                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25208                                  
 25209                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 25210 000018AF 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25211 000018B0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25212 000018B1 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 25213                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 25214 000018B3 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 25215 000018B6 E8FB03                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 25216 000018B9 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 25217                                  
 25218 000018BB 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25219 000018BD 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 25220                                  
 25221 000018BF E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 25222 000018C2 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 25223 000018C5 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 25224                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 25225 000018C7 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 25226                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 25227 000018C8 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 25228 000018C9 EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25229                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 25230 000018CB 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25231 000018CC 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25232 000018CD C3                      	retn

 25234                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25235                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;
 25236                                  ;
 25237                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 25238                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 25239                                  ;
 25240                                  ; Input:    DL = 2 : Use character table
 25241                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table
 25242                                  ;	    AL = character to be capitalized
 25243                                  ;
 25244                                  ; Output:   None
 25245                                  ;
 25246                                  ; Use:	INT 21h /w AH=65h
 25247                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25248                                  
 25249                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_Char:

 25254 000018D4 7234                    	jb	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;   
 25255

 25262 000018DC C3                      	retn

 25264                                  _$P_DCC_Go:				;AN000;
 25265 000018DD 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25266 000018DE 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25267 000018DF 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25268                                  
 25269                                  	;;lea	di,[cs:_$P_Char_CAP_Ptr] ;AC034; or use char CAPS table ?
 25270                                  	;lea	di,[_$P_Char_CAP_Ptr]
 25271                                  	; 07/09/2023
 25272 000018E0 BF[3B15]                	mov	di,_$P_Char_CAP_Ptr
 25273                                  _$P_DCC00:				;AN000;
 25274 000018E3 2E3815                  	cmp	[cs:di],dl		;AN000; already got table address ?
 25275 000018E6 7415                    	je	short _$P_DCC01		;AN000; no
 25276                                  
 25277                                  ;In this next section, ES will be used to pass a 5 byte workarea to INT 21h,
 25278                                  ; the GET COUNTYRY INFO call. This usage of ES is required by the function
 25279                                  ; call, regardless of what base register is currently be defined as cs.
 25280

 25328                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25329                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25330                                  ;
 25331                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25332                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25333                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25334                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25335                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25336                                  ;
 25337                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25338                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25339                                  ;
 25340                                  ; Output:    None
 25341                                  ;
 25342                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25343                                  ;
 25344                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25345                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25346                                  
 25347                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25348                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25349                                  
 25350                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25351                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25352                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25353 0000190B 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25354 0000190C 2E800E[B214]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25355 00001912 2E8026[B214]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25356                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25357 00001918 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25358 0000191B 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25359 0000191D 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25360                                  
 25361 0000191F 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25362 00001921 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25363                                  
 25364 00001923 2E800E[B214]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25365                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25366 00001929 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25367                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25368 0000192A E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25369 0000192D 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25370 0000192E C3                      	retn

 25634                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25635                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25636                                  ;
 25637                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25638                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25639                                  ;
 25640                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25641                                  ;
 25642                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25643                                  ;
 25644                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25645                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25646                                  
 25647                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25648                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25649 00001A0C 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25650 00001A0D 2EF606[B214]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25651 00001A13 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25652                                  
 25653 00001A15 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25654 00001A16 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25655                                  
 25656                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25657 00001A17 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25658 00001A18 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25659                                  
 25660 00001A1A F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25661 00001A1B C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25662                                  
 25663                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25664 00001A1C F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25665 00001A1D C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26387                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26388                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26389                                  ;
 26390                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26391                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26392                                  ;
 26393                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26394                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26395                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26396                                  ;
 26397                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26398                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26399                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26400                                  
 26401                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26402                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26403                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26404                                  ;
 26405                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26406                                  
 26407                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26408                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26409                                  
 26410                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26411                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26412                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26413                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26414 00001C9B BD[BB14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26415                                  
 26416                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26417 00001C9E 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26418 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26419                                  
 26420                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26421 00001CA2 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26422 00001CA4 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26423                                  
 26424 00001CA6 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26425                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26426                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26427 00001CA7 C3                      	retn
 26428                                  
 26429                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26430                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26431                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26432                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26433                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26434                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26435                                  
 26436                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26437                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26438 00001CA8 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26439 00001CAA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26440                                  
 26441 00001CAC 2E800E[B214]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26442                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26443                                  
 26444                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26445                                  	; cf=0
 26446                                  	;retn
 26447                                  
 26448                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26449                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26450                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26451 00001CB2 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26452                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;

 26454 00001CB3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26455                                  
 26456                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26457                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26458                                  ;
 26459                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26460                                  ;
 26461                                  ;  Input:
 26462                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26463                                  ;
 26464                                  ;  Output:
 26465                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26466                                  ;
 26467                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26468                                  ;
 26469                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26470                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26471                                  
 26472                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26473 00001CB4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26474 00001CB5 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26475 00001CB6 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26476                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26477                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26478                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26479 00001CB7 2E8B36[AF14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26480 00001CBC 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26481 00001CBE 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26482 00001CC0 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26483 00001CC1 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26484 00001CC2 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26485 00001CC3 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26486 00001CC4 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26487 00001CC5 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26488 00001CC6 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26489                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26490                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26491 00001CC7 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26492 00001CC9 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26493 00001CCC CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26494                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26495 00001CCE 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26496 00001CD0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26497 00001CD2 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26498 00001CD3 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26499 00001CD4 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26500 00001CD5 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26501 00001CD6 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26502 00001CD7 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26503 00001CD8 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26504 00001CD9 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26505                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26506 00001CDB 2E8936[AD14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26507 00001CE0 2E891E[AF14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26508                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26509                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26510                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26511                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26512 00001CE5 2EC536[AD14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26513                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26514 00001CEA 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26515 00001CED 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26516 00001CEF 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26517 00001CF1 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26518 00001CF3 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26519 00001CF6 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26520 00001CF8 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26521 00001CF9 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26522                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26523 00001CFB 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26524 00001CFC 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26525                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26526 00001CFD EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26527                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26528                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26529                                  	; cf=0
 26530                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26531                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26532 00001CFF 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26533 00001D00 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26534 00001D01 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26535 00001D02 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27100                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27101                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27102                                  
 27103                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27104                                  ;
 27105                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27106                                  ;
 27107                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27108                                  ;
 27109                                  ;   Modification log:
 27110                                  ;
 27111                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27112                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27113                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27114                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27115                                  ;
 27116                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27117                                  ;
 27118                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27119                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27120                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27121                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27122                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27123                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27124                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27125                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27126                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27127                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27128                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27129                                  ;
 27130                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27131                                  
 27132                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27133                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27134                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27135                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27136                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27137                                  
 27138                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27139                                  
 27140                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27141                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27142                                  
 27143                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27144                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27145                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27146                                  
 27147                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27148                                  ;
 27149                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27150                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27151                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 27152                                  ;	           line.
 27153                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27154                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27155                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27156                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27157                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27158                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27159                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 27160                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27161                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27162                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27163                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27164                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27165                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27166                                  ;	           for details).
 27167                                  
 27168 00001F02 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27169 00001F03 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27170 00001F04 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27171 00001F06 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27172 00001F07 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27173 00001F17 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27174 00001F37 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27175 00001F38 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27176 00001F39 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27177                                  
 27178                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27179                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27180                                  
 27181                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27182                                  
 27183                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27184                                  
 27185                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27186

 27189                                  
 27190                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27191                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27192                                  
 27193                                  		;public	DevEntry
 27194                                  
 27195 00001F3A 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded (paras)
 27196 00001F3C 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27197 00001F3E 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27198 00001F40 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27199 00001F44 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 27200                                  ; 30/12/2022

 27203                                  ;
 27204 00001F49 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 27205 00001F4A 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; current UMB used for loading devices (paras)
 27206 00001F4C 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 27207 00001F4E 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free mem blk in the current UMB (paras)
 27208                                  ;

 27211 00001F54 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 27212 00001F56 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 27213                                  ;

 27216 00001F59 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 27217                                  ;
 27218 00001F5B 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12h ?
 27219 00001F5C 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12h ram)

 27234                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27235                                  
 27236                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27237                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 27238                                  
 27239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27240                                  ;
 27241                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27242                                  ;
 27243                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27244                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27245                                  ;
 27246                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27247                                  
 27248                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27249                                  doconf:
 27250 00001F6E 0E                      	push	cs
 27251 00001F6F 1F                      	pop	ds
 27252                                  
 27253 00001F70 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27254                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27255 00001F73 CD21                    	int	21h
 27256 00001F75 8816[1546]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27257                                  
 27258                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 27259                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27260                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27261                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27262 00001F79 8816[1346]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27263                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27264                                  
 27265 00001F7D BA[2A45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ; now pointing to file description
 27266 00001F80 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27267                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		; open file "config.sys"
 27268 00001F83 F9                      	stc				; in case of int 24h
 27269 00001F84 CD21                    	int	21h			; function request
 27270 00001F86 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27271                                  
 27272                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27273                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27274                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27275 00001F88 E8F218                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 27276                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 27277                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 27278 00001F8B C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 27279 00001F90 C3                      	retn
 27280                                  noprob: 				; get file size (note < 64k!!)
 27281 00001F91 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27282 00001F93 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 27283 00001F95 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 27284                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 27285 00001F97 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 27286 00001F9A CD21                    	int	21h
 27287 00001F9C A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 27288                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27289 00001F9F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27290                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27291                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 27292                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 27293                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 27294                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 27295                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 27296 00001FA1 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 27297 00001FA4 CD21                    	int	21h
 27298                                  
 27299                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 27300 00001FA6 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27301                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27302                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27303                                  
 27304 00001FAA A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27305 00001FAD A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27306 00001FB0 E87CF1                  	call	ParaRound
 27307 00001FB3 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27308                                  
 27309                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27310                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27311                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27312                                  ;
 27313                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27314                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27315                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27316                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27317                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27318                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27319                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27320                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27321                                  ;
 27322 00001FB5 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27323 00001FB6 8916[9714]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27324 00001FBA 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27325                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27326                                  
 27327 00001FBC 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27328                                  	
 27329                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27330 00001FBF 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27331 00001FC3 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27332                                  	
 27333                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27334                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27335                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27336                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27337                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27338                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27339                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]	
 27340                                  
 27341                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27342                                  	; ds = cs
 27343 00001FC7 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27344                                  
 27345 00001FCB 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27346 00001FCD 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27347                                  
 27348 00001FCF 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27349                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27350                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27351 00001FD1 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27352                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27353 00001FD3 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27354 00001FD4 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27355 00001FD6 9C                      	pushf
 27356

 27491 00002054 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27492 00002055 E8AF21                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27493 00002058 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27494 0000205A E8AA21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27495 0000205D 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next

 27498                                  ;
 27499                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27500                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27501                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27502                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27503                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27504                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27505                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27506                                  ;   spot.
 27507                                  ;
 27508                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27509                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27510                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27511                                  ;   retrieved.
 27512                                  ;
 27513 00002063 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
